Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: AnaOsorio
Reviews.Content: Bad customer service Even that it was a non smoking room when i went in smelled terrible !!! and ion reception they did believe me !!! My family came to visit me, they stay there was the worst welcome i could have giving them !! What i like was that is in a good location. Its not good value for money. The presentation of the room was awful the bed were no well made

Reviews.Title: “Good value for reasonable room in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dodmic
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the Gemini Hotel Randwick, booked online. Although currently no shuttle bus service from airport, a public bus (400) takes you to within 100m of the hotel for less than $5. Hotel under renovation, so great value rooms on offer; check in courteous and helpful, room perfectly adequate and no problems encountered due to the renovations. Easy travel by bus to city centre and Eastern suburbs - good location. Plenty of shops near hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good thing it was only for one night.”
Reviews.Author: lalenawalter
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Expedia, and I believe they rated it a 3 star hotel.....hahahhahah. We were escorted to the elevator by our friendly cockroach. The rooms were clean and the cost was under 100/night. I would say the room was decorated sometime in the 70's and hasn't been changed since. They are in the process of renovating, so maybe there will some improvements. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is not near the main hub of Sydney, but the bus system is easy and inexpensive, so you can get where you need to go. Taxi's seem pretty pricey. Expedia said they offered a shuttle, but it was discontinued a few weeks prior to our arrival. Alright for a quick stop, but I wouldn't stay long.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel friendly staff great service ideal stop over location”
Reviews.Author: Breffni054
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in the Gemini en route to Brisbane. From airport pick up to drop off the folowing morning everything was perfect. Reception staff more than helpful. Room .secure and safe for solo traveller. Good breakfast. Good location. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Aiport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelled61
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel for a couple of nights especially before and after a flight, then this is the place to go. I stayed at the Gemini for 2 nights with my mother and 22 yo daughter. We paid $120 per night for a Family Room. When we arrived at Central Station I rang the hotel to arrange a transfer and was told it would be about 20-25 mins. We had a coffee at the station and went outside where the minibus picked us up on time. We were driven to the hotel and were checked in by a lovely young man who also arranged for a transfer to take us to the airport the next morning where my daughter was catching an international flight. We were given the keys to Room 501 which was quite a large room with a queen bed and two singles. The room overlooked the main street and we had views to the Harbour Bridge. The room was clean, the sheets and towels white and spotless. Tea, coffee, milk and biscuits were supplied. The bathroom was only small and a rather bizarre shape but there was plenty of hot water and a great shower rose. We asked for advice as to where to have a good cheap meal and were given directions to the Randwick Labor Club just around the corner. We were also given a drink voucher to redeem with a Main Meal at the club. There are plenty of other restaurants all within walking distance of the hotel however we found the meal at the RLC to be very good. The next morning we were picked up on time for our transfer to the airport. My mother and I returned to the hotel by taxi (our choice, I'm sure the hotel would have picked us up). The taxi fare was $40. Later in the afternoon we took a taxi into central Sydney at a cost of $20. The rooms overlooking the street can be a bit noisy (it is a main street in a Sydney suburb after all) however, I always wear earplugs so I didn't notice. The bathroom certainly was one of the smaller ones I've been in but I don't tend to spend much time in the bathroom and I couldn't complain about the cleanliness or lack of amenities. My family and I have used the Gemini Hotel on many occasions as a stopover before a flight. This hotel is ideal for use as an airport hotel. It's as cheap as chips ($240 for 2 nights for up to four people, which included at least $60 worth of free transfers and a drink voucher). I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: GriffithYvon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gemini for 4 days, due to a family member in Hospital, The Gemini is in walking distance of the hospital and very close to shops and restaurants which are all very reasonably priced, bus close to front door and free bus service to airport. We travelled by car, car parking was free but car park is very tight you wouldnâ€™t want to try and get a big car up into the car park, and you would be very lucky to get a park on the ground floor for a 4x4. The room had tea and coffee facilities, TV was set down on the floor (way to low), only a few channels worked, bathroom way to small, not enough room to hang anything it needs a shelf and more hooks, the shower head constantly drips, there is no water pressure, the water would fluctuate from boiling hot (if you could get any) to freezing cold, the bathroom door would not lock it would swing open while you were in the shower. The walls seem to be paper thin and you could hear the people in the next room as if they were in the room with you. The hall way was narrow. The beds were OK, linen was clean, we had a double bed and single in the room as well as a small table and three chairs, plenty of room for luggage, we canâ€™t complain about the size of the room. We had a small balcony only big enough for one at a time two if you squeezed but no room for a chair. The staff at the front desk that I dealt with seemed very willing to help, one of the lifts not working (we had no luck with it) the other was slow, the hotel restaurant was closed when we were there but plenty of restaurants just out the front door. I would recommend this hotel if youâ€™re on a budget, if you have the money I would go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “A friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: haematocrit
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be ideal for a 1 night stay when flying out of Sydney. The hotel provided free shuttle bus from Central Station and to the airport, saving considerable cab fares. While there is no wireless internet, the manager kindly used the hotel computer to print the on-line check-in boarding passes for our flight. The buffet breakfast provided a wide choice with an added bonus of poached eggs cooked to order. Yes, the bathroom is somewhat small, but we had plenty of hot water and supplies. The nearby Labour Club is great for dinner and there is also a good variety of small restaurants in the main street.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, clean, quiet haven”
Reviews.Author: allanne
Reviews.Content: We needed accommodation close to Prince of Wales Hospital to visit a relative & the Gemini is a perfect, less than 5 minute walk. It's ideally located in the main Randwick shopping precinct, and is close to cafes, restaurants, supermarkets, Sydney buses & cinemas. Our twin room on the 5th floor was clean & quiet with everything we needed for a comfortable & pleasant stay. The reception staff were welcoming, friendly & very helpful. We were in the midst of a stressful family medical emergency & the Gemini provided a relaxing oasis in the midst of that.

Reviews.Title: “Leaking shower ceiling and no hot water!”
Reviews.Author: ScorpNsw
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times before. Cheaper than many places, however you get what you pay for. Recent stay with my family was disastrous with no hot water after coming back late at night. Awoke the next morning to water (?) running into our shower from above. Awful! The bathroom cleanliness was not up to speed either. When speaking to the front desk about the problems I was told to write a letter to the management. Management responded to my letter by refusing to accept a request for a refund! I would not recommend staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Checked out after seeing the room”
Reviews.Author: stacomagirl
Reviews.Content: Booked it for 20th wedding anniversary thinking it would be OK .Not expecting it to be flash because of the price but it was convenient to where we wanted to visit on the weekend .After negotiating the difficult tiny carpark & the lift that doesn't like to go anywhere , we arrived in the room . We stayed there a whole half an hour before checking out , didn't even get a partial refund .They just asked us why we were leaving & looked at us dumbfounded . The room was so small that the door literally hit the bed when you entered the room .You felt like you were sleeping in the hallway because there was so much noise from the room across the hall you could hear every word & their TV . You felt you could practically reach out & touch people walking down the hallway .Tiny bathroom, tiny balcony .Not very romantic or private at all . Photos not very up to date on wotif website where we booked it .Called reception & they offered another room & we looked at it but it was a lot more expensive just because it had extra beds , which we wouldn't even use & it reeked of smoke as it was on a smoking floor.After a few phone calls we checked out & went to the Rydges World Square in Pitt St in the city which was not that much more expensive & was a lovely large King room & a 5 star experience.So glad we did even though we lost our full night's money at the Gemini it was worth it to go to Rydges.Had a much better time , we just had to get a bus to & from Randwick that night to go to the Hordern Pavillion which was where our entertainment was on . Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_CanadaAlex
Reviews.Content: For the purpose of a one night's stay ($135AUD), followed by courtesy shuttle to the airport, this one passed the test, especially when compared to the exorbinate cost of the hotels in the airport area that I've used in the past. For some reason the hotel restaurant was temporarily closed, but the hotel offered the Randwick Labour Club as an alternative and that proved a definite plus. I spent a lot of my childhood in the Randwick - Coogee area, so I felt very comfortable there. The shuttle bus driver was a decent guy and the front desk staff were friendly enough. We didn't see any insects in our room, but I would agree the room was a little shabby. I'd stay there again for one night, as I know the one's at the Airport are a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Biting Insects, Manky Carpets, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: skywok
Reviews.Content: I was bitten 3 times in 5 minutes by what seeemed to be fleas or bedbugs. That was before I even sat down! The room was dusty, the edges of the carpet lined with dust & the carpets well and due ready for both cleaning and replacement. I couldn't stay, we had to leave. I am well used to 4 or 5 star standards, but surely a bug free environment is not too much to ask. Staff are wonderfully friendly, helpful and sincere - service excellent. Unfortunately, there neeed to be some more changes made to this hotel to make it worth staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas!”
Reviews.Author: shanso
Reviews.Content: During the first night in the 'family room' we awoke with a burning and itching sensation on our hands. We initially believed these bites to be mosquitos, but after the second night it was clear that these bites were from fleas. A dead and blood engorged flea was found in the bed to confirm our suspicion. We reported this to management and found their response to be less than interested. Eventually, a small discount was given and a vague apology was given after some pushing... For a room that cost $130, the last thing we expected was to sleep in a flea infected room....

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: x40ros
Reviews.Content: Booked one night at the Gemini before flying out of Sydney the next day. Chose it because it was supposedly near the airport, it offered free airport transfers and the website made it look ok. First of all, when we returned our hire car to the airport, we looked for the courtesy bus. We were directed to the general area where all the buses picked up from. After waiting to see if a bus turned up, I telephoned to ask whether we could be picked up. There was confusion as to where the pick up would take place from, I was told to go to a different place. However other drivers insisted that the bus picked up from where we were standing. Anyway after a half hour wait, we were collected, the mini bus looked rather beaten up. The hotel was a considerable drive from the airport, being in the suburb of Randwick. First impressions of the lobby were good, and as shown on the website. However, once we got into the lift things got worse, the inside was quite tired and the landings were the same. We had 2 rooms, a family room and a twin. The family room was ok, looked quite recently painted and certainly appeared to be clean, although some of the furniture was quite old looking. The twin room was a different matter, it was a ghastly, puke colour, with tired furniture. My friend, who stayed in it, said everything 'was broken'. If our stay had been for longer than 1 night, I would have been very disappointed and asked to move. At the time of our visit, the hotel restaurant was being refurbished and arrangements had been made for guests to use the nearby labour club. I think this was a good move because we stayed there as long as possible to avoid going back to our rooms and the surroundings were good. On the plus side, when we arrived, we booked a time for our return trip to the airport and that worked well. The location of the hotel is right in the middle of the 'high street', which meant some street noise early in the morning but did mean that there were plenty of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff in reception, and the mini bus drivers, were all polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OK for budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwi024
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before an early morning flight. Although the place could do with an undate everything was clean and tidy and confortable for a one night stay. Only problem we found was we asked for a 5.15am wake up call but got that at 4.45 and also had booked the 6.15 shuttle but when we went down to reception was told our booking was for the 7.15am shuttle. We told them that would be too late and so at their expense organised a taxi for us to the airport. For the $100au we paid I though excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Airport Hotel Find”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_and_Dennis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only to cure jet lag following a flight from SFO. It exceeded our expectation. Our twin room cost $135. It was clean, and the room was well maintained. The room, although small met our needs, and reminded us of a small European style family hotel. As other reviewers noted, the airport shuttle was very professionally operated. The front desk was efficient. The hotel is situated in the middle of what could be Main Street in any small town, with lots of small neighborhood type restaurants and shops (but no clubs, so the street was quiet at night.) The neighborhood felt quite safe. We would not hesitate to stay at The Gemini Hotel for a longer stay. The Sydney eastern suburb of Radwick is only 15 minutes from downtown Sydney by public transit bus, which stops right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Dxr_7
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days in the gemini hotel, randwick with 3 other friends. The free airport transport service was professional and courteous. Even when we were departing and accidentally left our wallet in the bus, he made the extra trip back to return it to us at the airport. The hotel staff even went to the nearby cafe to help look for the missing wallet as well. Well done During the stay, one of our beds was a bit soft, but housekeeping made the extra effort to replace the mattress with a firmer one to ensure a comfortable night's rest when informed. Over the weekend unfortunately some unruly residents were making a bit of noise but one call to the reception and prompt service soon quelled the disturbance. Facilities wise, the bathrooms were a tad cramped but were kept clean and good hot water for nice warm showers. Location: lots of eating places and shops nearby. also, free transport to the central railway station can be arranged with the front desk Overall, kudos to the hotel and staff. worth coming back anytime

Reviews.Title: “Utmost Convenience and Personalized Service”
Reviews.Author: glitch06
Reviews.Content: Whenever I stay in a hotel, I put prime importance to the service it brings me. I must say, Gemini Hotel tops my list in terms of personalized service and utmost convenience. The airport transfer was very professional and courteous. Room service was fine. They had laundry, tea-making facilities that served so much convenience during our stay (stayed there with some business colleagues in Sydney). I would have to agree that the room was surprisingly spacious. It was really a great comfort to stay there after a hard day's work. Loved the balcony view also. It was relaxing. From their online booking (via their website which offers the best rates) up to the guest's stay, it was nothing but convenience and personalized service. Will stay there again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Spacious”
Reviews.Author: ESQTeam
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Gemini Hotel. Paid A$135 a night. We missed the airport transfer when we arrived because our flight was delayed and we got out of the airport after the 10:15pm deadline. When we walked into the room we were surprised at the spaciousness. I believe the room was a double. The room was almost split into two. The "separate room" was spacious with a couch and TV. The "kitchen" area was a nice surprise with a sink and drying rack. The bathroom was a little cramped and there was food under the couch, but the balcony view of the city was nice. Only problem is you choose between the Randwick traffic or the boy's school that sounds an alarm every change of period. The hotel is a good A$20 - A$30 taxi ride to the city one-way. Pretty costly when you consider everything to do is in the city. The hotel does not offer internet access in the rooms. Had to pay A$2 - A$3 at the next door internet cafe. Also, the room does not have its own ironing board you have to go to the third floor. The airport transfer back to the airport was nice and professional.

HotelInfo.Name: Gemini Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 65 Belmore Road, Sydney, New South Wales 2031, Australia
